title: Set uploaded photo as full-width hero background

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image file `myplace-qro-hero-image.jpeg` to the frontend static assets and use it as the Hero section full-width background image.

quotes: 1. Full-width background, 2. Stay the same,  and 3. as-is

acceptanceCriteria: The file `myplace-qro-hero-image.jpeg` is present in the frontend’s publicly served static assets (e.g., under `frontend/public/assets/...`) and is accessible by URL in the browser.

`frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx` no longer references `/assets/generated/hero-day-of-the-dead-mexican-tradition.dim_1920x1080-2.png` for the hero background, and instead references the uploaded JPEG asset URL.
The hero background renders full-width behind the hero content (background covers the hero area and remains centered).

requirements.text: Keep all existing Hero section content (headline text, description text, buttons, layout, and scroll indicator) unchanged while swapping only the background image.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero headline, paragraph copy, button labels, and button click behaviors remain exactly as before.
No changes are made to the hero section structure/layout other than the background image source.

requirements.text: Use the uploaded image as-is (no cropping, retouching, color adjustments, or generated variants); only apply the existing hero overlay/gradient and CSS positioning needed to display it as a background.
acceptanceCriteria: No new edited or regenerated versions of the uploaded image are introduced.
The hero uses the original JPEG file as the displayed background source (not a transformed/renamed derived image).

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI components).
No backend changes are required for this update.
nonGoals: Redesigning the hero section’s typography, copy, buttons, or layout.
Adding new hero interactions or animations beyond what already exists.
Changing global metadata (e.g., HTML title, SEO tags) as part of this request.
